intro: Lomatogonium deltoideum, commonly known as the delta lomatia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Lomatogonium deltoideum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
